newsitem.title: USA: Reynolds confirms Kuwait jv smelter talks.
newsitem.headline: Reynolds confirms Kuwait jv smelter talks.

text.p: Reynolds Metals Co, the U.S. aluminum group, confirmed it has had talks with Raytheon Co regarding a $1 billion smelter project in Kuwait, approved by the country's finance ministry earlier this week.
"Reynolds has had discussions with Raytheon regarding technology for the project," said Reynolds' spokesman Joe Vagi.
"However, we have not signed any technology agreements and we do not have an equity position in the project."
The talks with Raytheon were on-going, Vagi added.
Kuwait has approved a plan by Raytheon Co to build the $1 billion smelter in a joint venture with local and foreign partners.
The project was proposed by Raytheon to fulfill an offset obligation incurred on its Gulf War sale to Kuwait of Patriot air-defence missiles and launchers.
Industry sources in Kuwait had said Reynolds was in talks with Raytheon regarding technology and could also be a possible partner in the project.
Reynolds is currently providing technology for the new aluminum smelter in Nigeria, Vagi said.
